title: Weekly Prayer Times: sticky Day/Date column with proper separation on mobile horizontal scroll

requirements.summary: Prevent the left Day/Date column from being visually covered/merged during horizontal scroll by enforcing a true sticky first column with opaque background and clear separator inside a horizontally scrollable container.
acceptanceCriteria: On narrow/mobile widths, the weekly table scrolls horizontally inside its own container (not the whole page).
While horizontally scrolling, the first column (Day/Date) stays fixed on the left and never gets covered by other columnsâ€™ text.
The sticky first column has an opaque background so underlying cells do not show through.
A visible separator (border and/or shadow) remains between the sticky first column and the scrollable time columns in both light and dark mode.

file_operations.description: Harden `.weekly-prayer-table-wrapper`, `.weekly-prayer-table`, and sticky-column CSS so the table only scrolls within its wrapper and the first column is fully readable: make sticky backgrounds fully opaque (no alpha), ensure the table uses compatible border-collapsing (e.g., `border-collapse: separate` if needed), and strengthen the separator treatment (border/shadow) for both light and dark mode.

Adjust Weekly Prayer Times table markup/classes (without editing shadcn files under `frontend/src/components/ui`) so the sticky Day/Date column is applied consistently and remains visually separated during horizontal scroll (e.g., ensure the wrapper and table class names align with the updated CSS and avoid any class combinations that cause translucent overlap).

requirements.summary: Make sticky-column styling consistent between header and body (including today row) by aligning sticky positioning, z-index layering, background treatment, and separator so no header/body mismatch occurs while scrolling.
acceptanceCriteria: The sticky header cell and sticky body cells share consistent `position: sticky; left: 0;` behavior and visually match (background + separator).
Z-index layering is correct so the sticky column (including header) always appears above scrollable columns, with no flicker when scrolling.
The 'today' row styling does not reduce readability of the sticky column and remains consistent while scrolling.

file_operations.description: Unify sticky column rules for header/body by defining consistent sticky base styles (position/left/background/separator) and explicit z-index tiers (e.g., header above body) to avoid flicker and stacking issues; ensure the 'today' sticky cell background remains opaque and readable while preserving the row highlight.

Ensure the header sticky cell and body sticky cells use the same sticky class contract (including the same separator and background logic) and that the 'today' row styling does not introduce transparency or class conflicts that could reduce sticky-column readability during horizontal scrolling.
